page.title: 01Our Area
page.content: The area is largely agricultural being mainly grassland with some cultivated crops grown. There are four villages each with its own primary school and one or two shops. The nearest shopping centre is Ilkeston and the nearest large towns are Derby and Nottingham. The primary schools feed a number of comprehensive schools all of which are outside the D block. The largest village, West Hallam has grown recently due to the building of many new houses, but the other three villages remain small with a strong sense of community. There is no industry in the area now but there are many small disused coal mines and some of the oldest houses in Stanley Common were built for coal miners.
